intro: Mahernia spinosa, commonly known as the spiny mahernia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive spiny appearance. Mahernia spinosa produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
